intro: Amyema acuta, commonly known as the acute amyema, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Amyema acuta is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained conditions and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for local pollinators and supporting various wildlife species.
